GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, the estimated GDP per capita in Paraguay amounted to around 5,823.76 U.S. dollars.

Gross domestic product (GDP) denotes the aggregate value of all services and goods produced within a country in any given year. GDP is an important indicator of a country's economic power. In 2018, Madagascar's gross domestic product amounted to around 57.18 billion international dollars.

This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Panama between 2000 and 2017. The Gini coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. As of 2017, Panama had a Gini coefficient of 4.99, an improvement from 51.9 as of 2015.

GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, the estimated GDP per capita in Bhutan amounted to around 3,951.92 U.S. dollars.
This statistic shows the poverty rate in New Jersey from 2000 to 2019. In 2019, about 7.36 percent of New Jersey's population lived below the poverty line.
The statistic shows the national debt of Portugal from 2014 to 2019, with projections up until 2024. In 2019, the national debt of Portugal amounted to around 268.43 billion U.S. dollars.
The statistic shows the number of League of Legends (LoL) monthly active users (MAU) from 2011 to 2016. In 2016, League of Legends had 100 million monthly active users.
This statistic shows the crude death rate in Sweden from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the crude death rate in Sweden was 9.5 deaths per thousand inhabitants.
This statistic shows the household penetration rates for dog-ownership in the United States from 1988 to 2016. In 2016, 48 percent of U.S. households owned a dog.
This statistic shows the proportion of cigarette smokers in Great Britain in 2012, by socio-economic classification. In 2012, 33 percent of people in managerial or professional status were cigarette smokers.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Azerbaijan from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. The population of Bulgaria increased gradually over the course of the next ten years, reaching a peak in the early 1900s, when it amounted to approximately 9.4 million inhabitants. By the end of the nineteenth century, Bulgaria's population had increased by almost a million people, and by the turn of the twentieth century it had reached a peak of approximately 9.4 million inhabitants.

This statistic shows the EBITDA of the Italian luxury fashion company Prada Group between 2012 and 2019. The EBITDA is the earnings before interests, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) of the Italian company Prada. It is calculated as the difference between the EBITDA of the company and the EBITDA of the company's subsidiaries. It can be seen that the EBITDA fluctuated during the period under observation, reaching a value of approximately 551 million euros as of 2019.

It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Japanese population was 44.7 years.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Spain from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Spanish population was 39 years.

The statistic shows the average inflation rate in India from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the average inflation rate in India amounted to about 3.86 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Kuwait from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Kuwaiti population was 23.5 years.

This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Bolivia between 2000 and 2017. The Gini coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. As of 2017, Bolivia had a Gini coefficient of 46.6, an improvement from 56.3 as of 2015.

This statistic shows the Corruption Perception Index score obtained by El Salvador from 2012 to 2019. The Corruption Perception Index is a composite indicator that includes data on the perception of corruption in areas such as: bribery of public officials, kickbacks in public procurement, embezzlement of state funds, and effectiveness of governments' anti-corruption efforts. The highest possible score in perception of corruption is 0, whereas a score of 100 indicates that no corruption is perceived in the respective country. In El Salvador, the corruption perception index score reached 39 in 2019.

This statistic shows the average inflation rate in France from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the average inflation rate in France amounted to about 0.61 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Chile between 2000 and 2017. The Gini coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. As of 2017, Chile had a Gini coefficient of 52.1, an improvement from 50.8 as of 2015.

This statistic shows the median age of the Italian population from 1980 to 2018. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2018, the median age of the Italian population was 46.3 years.

The infant mortality rate in the Netherlands, for children under the age of one year old, was 201 deaths per thousand births in 1840. This means that for all children born in 1840, the infant mortality rate in the Netherlands was at its lowest in the nineteenth century. Over the course of the next 150 years, the infant mortality rate in the Netherlands has increased steadily, reaching its lowest point ever in 2020.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Jamaica from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the population of Jamaica was 24.9 years.

GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, the GDP per capita in Denmark amounted to around 58,641.91 U.S. dollars.

The statistic shows the monthly exchange rate (as of the end of each month) of the euro to the Swiss franc (EUR CHF), according to data from the European Central Bank, from January 2014 to November 2020. The monthly exchange rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. The product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, electricity, gas, electricity, gas, electricity, and gas) of the euro to the Swiss franc.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Tunisia from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Tunisian population was 21.3 years.
Life expectancy in China was just under 50 in the year 1850, and over the course of the next ten years, it is expected to have increased to 67 by the year 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout China's history, there were several times where it fell short, such as in the 1850s, when the population grew at a rapid rate.

The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Austrian population was 40 years.

This statistic shows the Los Angeles Dodgers all-time home run leaders as of October 2020. Duke Snider has hit the most home runs in Los Angeles Dodgers franchise history with 389 home runs.
This statistic presents the share of video on demand users in selected countries worldwide as of October 2015. During the survey period, it was found that 38 percent of video on demand users in the United States accessed video on demand services.
This statistic shows the results of a survey among internet users in the United Kingdom (UK) on how many days a week they open a business. 93 percent of respondents stated that they opened a business for seven days or less.
This statistic shows the voter support for Barack Obama and Mitt Romney in the 2012 election, by party affiliation. In the 2012 election, 94 percent of Democrats and 93 percent of Republicans voted for Barack Obama.
This statistic shows the monthly mobile data traffic in Western Europe from 2016 to 2021. In 2021, the monthly mobile data traffic in Western Europe is expected to amount to approximately 4.19 billion terabytes.
This statistic shows the locations where consumers most often buy food in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2015. During the survey period, it was found that 19 percent of respondents bought food in next door grocery stores.
This statistic shows the visitor exports in selected countries worldwide from 2016 to 2017. In 2017, the U.S. visitor exports amounted to 212.53 billion U.S. dollars.
The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) in Mongolia from 1984 to 2019, with projections up until 2021. Gross domestic product (GDP) denotes the aggregate value of all services and goods produced within a country in any given year. GDP is an important indicator of a country's economic power. In 2019, Mongolia's gross domestic product amounted to around 46.72 billion international dollars.
The statistic shows the growth in real GDP in Ghana from 2015 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. In 2019, Ghana's real gross domestic product grew by around 2.18 percent compared to the previous year.
This statistic presents the frequency with which consumers engage with brands they follow on social media in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2015. During the survey period, it was found that 79 percent of respondents engaged with brands they followed on social media a day.

In the 2005/06 season, the average ticket price was 37.73 U.S. dollars. The Tampa Bay Lightning play their home games at the National Hockey League headquarters in Tampa, Florida.

This statistic shows the regional distribution of Catholics in 2010. In 2010, 47.5 percent of Catholics lived in Europe.
This statistic shows the deviation of the annual mean daily temperatures from the long term mean in the United Kingdom (UK) from 2001 to 2019. The annual mean daily temperature dipped to 0.8 degrees Celsius in 2019.
This statistic shows the birth rate in Belgium from 2010 to 2019, with projections up until 2022. The birth rate is the average number of live births per thousand people in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, the birth rate in Belgium amounted to 1.63 live births per thousand people.

This statistic shows the population change in Sudan from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, Sudan's population increased by approximately 2.21 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the share of consumers willing to pay more for environmentally friendly products in Mexico in 2019, by type. In that year, 53 percent of Mexican consumers were willing to pay more for environmentally friendly products.
According to a survey conducted in Brazil in March 2020, 59 percent of respondents with a monthly income over 10 times the minimum wage said they could work from home during the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, while 40 percent of respondents with a monthly income of less than 10 times the minimum wage said they could work from home. The first case of COVID-19 in Brazil was confirmed on February 27, 2020. For further information about the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.
